page.title: 11The Crown Inn At Weston
page.content: {THE CROWN INN AT WESTON} Eariest history unknown, first public record of the Inn is 1440 as part of the endowment of All Souls College,Ox- ford by Arch. Chicele. First ref: of a private hostelrie on a small cross- roads is 1593 & complete records there after are dispayed in the Main Bar. Today the Crown is more than just a Pub being the focal point for Social & Organised activities; Local Cttees. such as Young Farmers & Rotary, May Fete & Political Organisations meet there; Darts & Skittles Matches are held & Traditional & Jazz Music played most weeks. Morris Men dance outside while inside Shove-Hapenny & Dominoes are to hand. Local Beers are on tap & Special bottled Stouts etc. with most Spirits. Also hot/cold food served. Welcome is given to children & adults so the Crown is more Club than Pub.
